dashboard.title: AMRnet Dashboard
dashboard.description: This is the main dashboard page of AMRnet. Here you can view and manage various aspects of the system.

about.title: About
about.subtitle: Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance Network
about.paragraph1: The AMRnet dashboard aims to make high-quality, robust and reliable genome-derived AMR surveillance data accessible to a wide audience. Visualisations are geared towards showing national annual AMR prevalence estimates and trends over time, which can be broken down and explored in terms of underlying genotypes and resistance mechanisms. We do not generate sequence data, but we hope that by making publicly deposited data more accessible and useful, we can encourage and motivate more sequencing and data sharing.

paragraph2.intro: We started with Salmonella Typhi and built on our
paragraph2.middle1: dashboard which uses data that have been curated by the
paragraph2.middle2: (to improve data quality and identify which datasets are suitable for inclusion) and analysed in
paragraph2.middle3: (to call AMR determinants and lineages from sequence data). Additional organisms have been added, using data sourced from
paragraph2.end: , however these dashboards are in beta mode as data curation is still ongoing. More organisms will be added throughout 2025.

paragraph3.text: A major barrier to using public data for surveillance is the need for careful data curation in order to identify which datasets are relevant for inclusion in pooled estimates of AMR and genotype prevalence. This kind of curation can benefit a wide range of users and we plan to work with additional organism-specific communities to curate data, and to contribute to wider efforts around metadata standards. Please get in touch if you would like to work with us (

paragraph4.text: Find out more about the project team (based at London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine), and our policy advisory group,

paragraph5.intro: The dashboard code is open access and available in
paragraph5.middle3: to access the data. Issues and feature requests can be posted

citation.title: Citation for AMRnet
citation.intro: If you use the AMRnet website or code, please cite AMRnet (Louise Cerdeira, Vandana Sharma, Mary Maranga, Megan Carey, Zoe Dyson, Kathryn Holt),

about.funding: The project is funded by the Wellcome Trust (grant 226432/Z/22/Z).

publicHealth.title: Public Health Official
publicHealth.description: Epidemiologist, policy maker, or surveillance coordinator

welcome.label: Welcome to AMRnet
welcome.title: Understanding AMRnet
welcome.description: AMRnet is your window into global antimicrobial resistance patterns

whatIs.title: What is AMRnet?
whatIs.content: AMRnet visualizes antimicrobial resistance patterns in bacteria worldwide. Think of it as a 'weather map' for antibiotic resistance.

whyImportant.title: Why is this important?
whyImportant.content: Understanding resistance patterns helps healthcare providers choose effective treatments and public health officials track resistance trends.

navigation.label: Navigating the Dashboard
navigation.title: Dashboard Layout
navigation.description: Learn how to use the interactive map and controls

map.title: The World Map
map.content: Countries are colored by resistance levels: Green = low resistance, Red = high resistance, Grey = insufficient data

filters.title: Filter Panel (Left)
filters.content: Use filters to focus on specific time periods, regions, or bacterial strains

variables.title: Variable Selection (Right)
variables.content: Choose which resistance patterns or bacterial strains to display on the map

interpretation.label: Interpreting Data
interpretation.title: Understanding the Results
interpretation.description: Learn how to read and interpret the visualizations

colors.title: Color Coding
colors.content: Darker colors indicate higher resistance rates. Always check the legend for exact percentages.

confidence.title: Data Confidence
confidence.content: Countries with â‰¥20 samples are most reliable. Be cautious with smaller sample sizes.

trends.title: Time Trends
trends.content: Use time series graphs to see if resistance is increasing, decreasing, or stable over time.

chatbot.typeSelection: To get started, could you tell me what best describes you?
chatbot.helpMessage: I'm here to help! You can ask me about how to use the map, understand resistance patterns, or interpret data for your role.

quickTips.title: Quick Start Tips
quickTips.tip1: Start with your region of interest
